document_data.Description: An asura resembled a [[human]] with marble-pale skin and huge red wings, which were made of flame. Their feet were armed with [[eagle]] claws and they wore loose [[toga]]s.
document_data.Abilities: Asuras possessed a unique blessing to temporarily grant the boon of discerning truth from lies to mortal creatures that faced asuras' examination and answered their questions truthfully.
document_data.Combat:
[[File:Sword of righteousness.jpg|thumb|280px|right|''An asura warrior.'']]
From time immemorial, asuras were messengers, not soldiers, but their strength and combat experience were not to be underestimated. They preferred to attack their opponents from the air, causing terrible wounds by claws and hand-held weapons. Being one of the wisest creatures in the [[outer planes]], they were immune to many forms of [[enchantment]] and were completely protected from [[illusion]]s. Thanks to their marvelous vision, an asura could easily recognize lies and punish the guilty. Asuras could also transform into a [[human]] or [[demihuman]] to go unnoticed. In this case, their abilities were retained.

Society.Diet: Asuras did not require food to sustain themselves. Instead they drew sustenance from the [[Positive Energy plane]].
Society.Relationships: Asuras were known to act as [[favored monster|servants]] of the deities [[Eilistraee]], [[Haela Brightaxe]], [[Thard Harr]], [[Aerdrie Faenya]], [[Corellon]], [[Deep Sashelas]], [[Erevan Ilesere]], [[Hanali Celanil]], [[Labelas Enoreth]], [[Rillifane Rallathil]], [[Sehanine Moonbow]], [[Shevarash]], [[Solonor Thelandira]], [[Cyrrollalee]], and [[Yondalla]].

document_data.History: Queen [[Morwel]] of the [[Celestial eladrin|eladrin]] was allied to a powerful [[brass dragon]] named [[Ronothere]]. Through him, she lent military aid to the cause of the [[archomental]] [[Zaaman Rul]] in his resistance against [[Imix]], and this aid included a squad of asuras.{{Cite dragon/353/Princes of Elemental Good|50}}
